All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Achievement
Represents an achievement in the game.
AchievementTests
 
AssetTests
Tests for assets.
CameraPositionEvent
The CameraPositionEvent class represents an event that is triggered when the camera position is updated in the game.
CreditScreen
A scene window consisting of a title, a scrollable widget and an exit button.
DayUpdatedEvent
The DayUpdatedEvent class represents an event that is triggered when the day is updated in the game.
DesktopLauncher
DesktopLauncher class to launch the Heslington Hustle game.
DialogueBox
A class to display a dialogue box for text and options on the screen.
DialogueScrollEvent
Communicate from GameLogic to GameUI a dialogue scroll event.
DialogueSetOptions
The DialogueSetOptions class represents a set of dialogue options and their corresponding events.
DialogueSetText
The DialogueSetText class represents an event that is triggered when the text of a dialogue box is set in the game.
DialogueUpdateState
The DialogueUpdateState class represents an event that is triggered when the state of a dialogue box is updated in the game.
DialogueUpdateState.State
The State enum defines the possible states of a dialogue box.
EnergyUpdatedEvent
The EnergyUpdatedEvent class represents an event that is triggered when the energy level is updated in the game.
EventBus
A simple event bus that allows subscribing to and publishing events.
EventBusTests
Tests for the EventBus class.
EventManager
A class that maps Object's event strings to actual Java functions.
EventManagerInterface
Interface for the event manager.
EventManagerTests
Tests for the EventManager class.
FadeBlackScreenEvent
The FadeBlackScreenEvent class represents an event that is triggered when the screen needs to fade to black.
GameLogic
A class that handles the game logic, including the player, time, energy, and map switching.
GameLogicInterface
Interface for the game logic.
GameLogicTests
Tests for the GameLogic class.
GameMap
Represents the game map.
GameObject
An object that stores a position and dimensions, but can also store extra properties when loaded from a tile map.
GameOverScreen
A screen that displays the player's stats at the end of the game.
GameRenderer
A class to render the game, including the player, map and UI elements.
GameRendererInterface
Interface for the game renderer.
GameScreen
Handles the majority of the game logic, rendering and user inputs of the game.
GameScreenProvider
Interface for providing information about the game screen.
GameStatsUpdatedEvent
The GameStatsUpdatedEvent class represents an event that is triggered when the game statistics are updated.
GameUi
A class to display the game's user interface, including the energy bar, time, stats, and dialogue box.
GameUiInterface
Interface for the game UI.
GdxTestRunner
A JUnit Runner for LibGDX applications.
HustleGame
A class that is initially created by DesktopLauncher, loads consistent files at the start of the game and initialises lots of important classes.
MapSwitchEvent
Communicate from GameLogic to GameRenderer a map switch event.
MenuScreen
A screen to display the game menu to the player has the buttons "Start", "Settings", "Credits, "Exit" ALso displays a tutorial window and an avatar select screen.
MockedClasses
A class to mock classes for testing.
OptionDialogue
Deprecated.
Creates a small window to receive a yes/no response from the player No longer used, but the code may still be useful.
PlayerInterface
Interface for the player.
PlayerInterface
A class handling everything needed to control and draw a player, including animation, movement and collision.
SettingsScreen
A screen to display settings to the player, lets the player adjust sound and music volume.
SoundManager
A class handling loading, playing and disposing of sounds.
SoundManagerInterface
Interface for the sound manager.
TimeUpdatedEvent
The TimeUpdatedEvent class represents an event that is triggered when the time is updated in the game.
